Parasitic diseases are often the burden of tropical and subtropical communities because those climates promote species richness

17 Climate change has the potential to alter or extend the natural ranges of these organisms and make regions of our globe that were previously uninhabitable for parasites habitable.
18 Increases in temperature affect the life cycles of parasites, which can directly affect how prevalent the organism is within the area, considering many parasitic organisms have a temperature-dependent developmental baseline, either within their host or in the environment.
